text: if you asked me what my all-time
favorite dessert would be it would start
with peaches anything peaches today
it's definitely peach cobbler cut your
peaches one and a half pounds into like
one inch cubes you can do it in two
slices as well so start with a pound and
a half of peaches if you wanted to and
you want it to vary the flavor a little
bit you can add some raspberries or some
blueberries both delicious additions add
a half a cup of sugar quarter cup if
they're really sweet and really juicy
a tablespoon of cornstarch for a little
bit of thickening
I don't know cobblers are great and
they're so variable too some of them
have biscuit toppings like the one I'm
making today a tablespoon of lemon juice
some have batter toppings some have pie
crust toppings
it's almost endless the different
variations that there are and they're
all called cobbler it's kind of crazy
and they're all delicious and they're
all really easy so they've all got that
going for them stir this around just so
everything is completely combined and
some of the juices will start to release
from the peaches as it sits and you make
it your biscuit topping I have a cup of
all-purpose flour in here to that I'm
gonna add three tablespoons of sugar so
the topping is slightly sweet not too
sweet though
gonna sugar a teaspoon of baking powder
and 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda 1/4
teaspoon salt whisk them together so
everything is well combined and then add
three tablespoons of butter that's been
cut up should be cold because you want
to have little pieces of butter left in
your mixture so that when it bakes your
biscuits are nice and flaky so I like to
use my fingers you can use one of these
this is a pastry cutter and it's
designed for cutting butter and flour
but I like to get my hands in there I
like to feel what I'm doing work quickly
though because you don't want your
butter to melt the key to flakiness and
pie crusts and biscuits and all things
like that is working cold so
old butter even cold flour if you want
to and then put it into a hot oven and
when you put it in the hot oven the
steam that's created from the melting
butter lifts up the biscuit or the the
pie crust and creates layers and flakes
rinse the flour off your hands and then
add 3/4 of a cup of cold buttermilk stir
just until combined you don't want to
over mix at this point you want to
maintain those pieces of butter that I
was talking about just a minute ago this
is a very moist dough so you're gonna
scoop it on top of your mixture
I like to use an ice cream scoop like
this I just find that it's easier and
since I have it I like to use it
whenever possible this is a 2 quart
baking dish just put your fruit into the
baking dish you can also make this in 8
1 cup ramekins if you want to do
individual drop your biscuits on top the
biscuits will spread out as it bakes so
leave some room between them and you can
sprinkle with just a tiny bit of sugar
have your oven preheating to 350 degrees
and bake until the fruit in the center
is bubbling and the biscuits on top are
nice and golden brown 35 to 45 minutes
